intro: Monanthemum cruegeri, commonly known as Crueger's tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Monanthemum cruegeri is often found in grasslands and along the edges of desert scrub habitats.
